universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration

Class ItemSpaceDecoration

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.ItemDecoration
      • universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration.RecyclerViewItemDecoration
        • universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration.ItemSpaceDecoration

  • public class ItemSpaceDecoration
extends RecyclerViewItemDecoration
    A RecyclerViewItemDecoration implementation that may be used to add a space, vertically and horizontally, between items displayed in a RecyclerView.

    Xml attributes

    ItemSpaceDecoration Attributes

    Default style attribute

    none
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    RecyclerView.addItemDecoration(RecyclerView.ItemDecoration)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class universum.studios.android.recycler.decoration.RecyclerViewItemDecoration

        RecyclerViewItemDecoration.Precondition

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ItemSpaceDecoration()
      Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(Context) with null context.
      ItemSpaceDecoration(Context context)
      Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(Context, AttributeSet) with null attrs.
      ItemSpaceDecoration(Context context, AttributeSet attrs)
      Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(Context, AttributeSet, int) with 0 defStyleAttr.
      ItemSpaceDecoration(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr)
      Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(Context, AttributeSet, int, int) with 0 defStyleRes.
      ItemSpaceDecoration(Context context, AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr, int defStyleRes)
      Creates a new instance of ItemSpaceDecoration for the given context.
      ItemSpaceDecoration(int horizontal, int vertical)
      Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(int, int, int, int) where the specified horizontal amount will be used for both, horizontal start and horizontal end amounts, and the vertical amount will be used similarly for both, vertical start and vertical end amounts.
      ItemSpaceDecoration(int horizontalStart, int horizontalEnd, int verticalStart, int verticalEnd)
      Creates a new instance of ItemSpaceDecoration with the specified spacing amounts.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Returns the amount of space by which to offset each item at the start in horizontal direction.

      Returns the amount of space by which to offset each item at the end in vertical direction.

      Returns the amount of space by which to offset each item at the start in vertical direction.
      protected void updateItemOffsets(Rect rect, boolean rtlDirection)
      Called to update the given rect with the current spacing offsets specified for this decoration.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemSpaceDecoration

        public ItemSpaceDecoration()
        Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(Context) with null context.

      • ItemSpaceDecoration

        public ItemSpaceDecoration(int horizontal,
                           int vertical)
        Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(int, int, int, int) where the specified horizontal amount will be used for both, horizontal start and horizontal end amounts, and the vertical amount will be used similarly for both, vertical start and vertical end amounts.

      • ItemSpaceDecoration

        public ItemSpaceDecoration(int horizontalStart,
                           int horizontalEnd,
                           int verticalStart,
                           int verticalEnd)
        Creates a new instance of ItemSpaceDecoration with the specified spacing amounts.
        Parameters:
        horizontalStart - Amount to be applied at the start of an item in horizontal direction.
        horizontalEnd - Amount to be applied at the end of an item in horizontal direction.
        verticalStart - Amount to be applied at the start of an item in vertical direction.
        verticalEnd - Amount to be applied at the end of an item in vertical direction.

      • ItemSpaceDecoration

        public ItemSpaceDecoration(@Nullable
                           Context context)
        Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(Context, AttributeSet) with null attrs.

      • ItemSpaceDecoration

        public ItemSpaceDecoration(@Nullable
                           Context context,
                           @Nullable
                           AttributeSet attrs)
        Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(Context, AttributeSet, int) with 0 defStyleAttr.

      • ItemSpaceDecoration

        public ItemSpaceDecoration(@Nullable
                           Context context,
                           @Nullable
                           AttributeSet attrs,
                           @AttrRes
                           int defStyleAttr)
        Same as ItemSpaceDecoration(Context, AttributeSet, int, int) with 0 defStyleRes.

      • ItemSpaceDecoration

        public ItemSpaceDecoration(@Nullable
                           Context context,
                           @Nullable
                           AttributeSet attrs,
                           @AttrRes
                           int defStyleAttr,
                           @StyleRes
                           int defStyleRes)
        Creates a new instance of ItemSpaceDecoration for the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be the new decoration presented.
        attrs - Set of Xml attributes used to configure the new instance of this decoration.
        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource for this decoration within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the new decoration.
        See Also:
        ItemSpaceDecoration(int, int, int, int)

    • Method Detail

      • getHorizontalStart

        public int getHorizontalStart()
        Returns the amount of space by which to offset each item at the start in horizontal direction.

        This value is used with respect to layout direction of the parent RecyclerView.

        Returns:
        Amount of space in pixels.
        See Also:
        getHorizontalEnd()

      • getHorizontalEnd

        public int getHorizontalEnd()
        Returns the amount of space by which to offset each item at the end in horizontal direction.

        This value is used with respect to layout direction of the parent RecyclerView.

        Returns:
        Amount of space in pixels.
        See Also:
        getHorizontalStart()

      • getVerticalStart

        public int getVerticalStart()
        Returns the amount of space by which to offset each item at the start in vertical direction.
        Returns:
        Amount of space in pixels.
        See Also:
        getVerticalEnd()

      • getVerticalEnd

        public int getVerticalEnd()
        Returns the amount of space by which to offset each item at the end in vertical direction.
        Returns:
        Amount of space in pixels.
        See Also:
        getVerticalStart()

      • getItemOffsets

        public void getItemOffsets(@NonNull
                           Rect rect,
                           @NonNull
                           View view,
                           @NonNull
                           RecyclerView parent,
                           @NonNull
                           RecyclerView.State state)
        Overrides:
        getItemOffsets in class RecyclerView.ItemDecoration

      • updateItemOffsets

        protected void updateItemOffsets(@NonNull
                                 Rect rect,
                                 boolean rtlDirection)
        Called to update the given rect with the current spacing offsets specified for this decoration.
        Parameters:
        rect - The desired item offsets rect to be updated.
        rtlDirection - True if offsets should be updated for RTL layout direction, false for LTR layout direction.
